intro: Stipa keniensis, commonly known as Kenyan needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that are typically green to brown in color. Its leaves are narrow and坚韧, adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Stipa keniensis is often found in open grasslands and along rocky outcrops, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various small animals.
